righttoprivacy wrote on July 13, 2024 at 5:59 AM (edited on July 13, 2024 at 6:03 AM )

Reply to comment by S0meoneStrange in US sanctions operators of “free VPN” that routed crime traffic through user PCs by z3d

True, anything that offers security or privacy, or potential for selective anonymity can be abused.

My thoughts in defense of I2P for anyone else reading in future: open source projects are used for all kinds of purposes.

Someone might use Audacity to record threatening audio manipulated for extortion - but Audacity being an open source project can be used by anyone, for anything it is useful for.

I2P being a very useful collaboration open source network project w/anonymity / privacy potential has many positive uses. Not created for committing crime. It's a tool, like a hammer - can be used responsibly. Or not. It's the responsibility of the user.

Intent is important in most legal standing.

nook_ OP wrote on July 7, 2024 at 12:48 PM (edited on July 7, 2024 at 4:18 PM )

Reply to comment by S0meoneStrange in Monero betting and lottery by nook_

First off, you cannot send irregular amounts like that. You can only send the exact amount you selected on the front page which must be in multiples of 0.01 XMR. If you selected 0.04 XMR then your bet attempt would have been rejected and the amount sent back to the provided address. If you selected a lower amount then the extra Monero would have been sent back after discovering the outcome of the bet.

Secondly I cannot find your provided address anywhere in the bet database, and I do not see any inflows in my wallet CLI that match your claimed bet amount, so I cannot help you unfortunately.

I am sorry to hear that you may have had a bad experience (if you are not making this claim in bad faith) and would urge you to try my service again the future. If you provided a bet number and something did look wrong on my end then I would be perfectly happy to send you any Monero I owe you manually and to fix my service based on your feedback.

  • Permalink
  • Parent
1

z3d OP wrote on June 25, 2024 at 12:59 PM

Reply to comment by privacy_is_dead in I2P+ 2.5.1+ released! by z3d

You shouldn't need a flatpak solution, installation isn't complex. The only dependency for installation is a Java installation, openjdk-{version}-jdk-headless on Linux normally works fine and should be available in your repos.

Once you've got Java installed, downloading an installer for I2P+ and then running java -jar ./i2pinstall.exe or whatever the name of the download is will launch the graphical installer. Running ~/i2p/i2prouter start post-installation (assuming you installed to ~/i2p/ ) should start the router and launch the console in your browser. Additional instructions available on skank.i2p .

  • Permalink
  • Parent
1
